page.title: 01Description of the Area.
page.content: There are twelve kilometres which we are covering. Most of the land is taken up by farmers, although there are only about four or five farms. The land lies North West of Dorchester, it's surface mainly hilly, uneven ground with coniferous woodland with a few plantations. The communications are:railways, two major roads, the A35 & A37 and also many minor roads.Our area is on the outskirts of Dorchester with parts of Charminster and Bradford Peverell on its boundary.Running through the area is the river Frome. At the moment the area is unspoilt but soon a bypass will ruin the beautiful environment.It has many Tumuli in and around the area, also a Roman Road.
